headline.main: OUR SPECIAL WASHINGTON DISPATCHES.; PROBABLE FLIGHT OF THE REBELS FROM VIRGINIA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The prevailing belief among military men in this City is that the rebels will fly from Virginia as a military necessity, fearing that they will be cut off from all railroad communication with their friends in the State of Virginia, that being the only means by which they can be reinforced and supplied, or by which they can escape.

headline.main: THE WAR IN TENNESSEE.; FROM CUMBERLAND GAP.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees have kept us on the qui vive for the last week. They have shown themselves several times in front of our works, and have once or twice placed their pickets in sight of our ours.

docs.snippet: EVENTS OF THE COMING WEEK.  The coming week will furnish an interesting page in the history of the rebellion and the country.  The War and Navy Departments to-day furnish no news that can be published.
